alert.note: Alert for Northern Erie; Southern Erie (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 16 at 11:32AM EST until January 16 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, lake effect snow occurring. Total snowfall of 3 to 7 inches. Winds gusting as high as 30 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 20 below zero. * WHERE...Erie County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 7 PM EST this evening. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 10 PM this evening to noon EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions and poor visibility. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A very tight snowfall gradient is expected across northern Erie County mainly near and north of I-90. The greatest snow accumulations are expected north of a line from Harborcreek to Findley Lake, including the town of North East. The heaviest snow is expected through early afternoon.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania Turnpike Commission remind motorists to adjust speeds based on driving conditions as winter weather impacts Pennsylvania roadways. Visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadway, and traffic conditions.
